body:
Comment 1: 
From http://tip.golang.org/ref/spec#Indexes:

A primary expression of the form a[x]
// snip
For a of type A or *A where A is an array type:
x must be an integer value; it is in range if 0 <= x < len(a), otherwise it is out
of range
a constant index must be in range
if a is nil or if x is out of range at run time, a run-time panic occurs
a[x] is the array element at index x and the type of a[x] is the element type of A
